Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly of Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); two faded added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of hound (head remaining), to right.
Curator's comments: The Wild Goat Style is usually characterised by a large amount of filling ornament. The small size of this sherd may explain the lack of filling ornament. Furthermore, the lack of interior decoration and the presence of a hound, which is rare in other styles, suggest that the sherd belongs within the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 251, no. 378, pl. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0158) (phase 2)
